intro: Chorispora sibirica, commonly known as Siberian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered with fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. It is native to the Arctic and temperate regions of Asia and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
